<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_SocketAddrSetPort_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_SocketAddrSetPort_Impl(OS_SockAddr_t *Addr, uint16 PortNum)
{
    in_port_t               sa_port;
    OS_SockAddr_Accessor_t *Accessor;

    sa_port  = htons(PortNum);
    Accessor = (OS_SockAddr_Accessor_t *)&Addr->AddrData;

    switch (Accessor->sa.sa_family)
    {
        case AF_INET:
            Accessor->sa_in.sin_port = sa_port;
            break;
#ifdef OS_NETWORK_SUPPORTS_IPV6
        case AF_INET6:
            Accessor->sa_in6.sin6_port = sa_port;
            break;
#endif
        default:
            return OS_ERR_BAD_ADDRESS;
    }

    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>

explanation: No code fragment modifies the pointer parameter Addr itself. The function only: (1) reads Addr to derive the address of its AddrData (&Addr->AddrData) and stores that address in a local pointer Accessor, (2) writes to members of the object pointed to by Addr (Accessor->sa_in.sin_port or Accessor->sa_in6.sin6_port), and (3) assigns PortNum to a local sa_port after conversion. According to MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified but the pointer itself shall not be modified — this code does not assign to Addr (or otherwise modify the pointer parameter). The cast to OS_SockAddr_Accessor_t* and use of Accessor are local operations that do not alter the function parameter. Therefore there are no fragments that require further investigation for Rule 17.8 compliance.
